journey.title: IC Software Engineer Interview Prep
journey.description: Master behavioral interviews for software engineering roles. Build compelling STAR/SPARC stories across all key competency areas.

step0_config.title: Customize Your Prep
step0_config.description: Tailor this journey to your role, target company, and key competencies

target_signals.label: Priority Competencies
target_signals.description: Select the signals most important for your target role

story_slots.title: Big, Hard Project / Largest Impact
story_slots.description: Your most impactful technical contribution. Focus on scope, complexity, and measurable results.
tips: Choose a project with measurable business impact
Focus on YOUR individual contributions, not just 'we'
Include concrete metrics (latency reduction, revenue increase, etc.)
Show technical depth and decision-making

story_slots.title: Ambiguous / Underspecified Work
story_slots.description: A time when requirements were unclear and you had to navigate uncertainty to deliver value.
tips: Emphasize how you clarified requirements
Show initiative in moving forward despite uncertainty
Discuss how you validated assumptions
Demonstrate comfort with incomplete information

story_slots.title: Major Conflict or Disagreement
story_slots.description: A significant technical disagreement with a teammate, manager, or stakeholder.
tips: Show emotional intelligence and professionalism
Demonstrate active listening and empathy
Focus on resolution, not blame
Highlight what you learned about collaboration

story_slots.title: Failure / Missed Expectation
story_slots.description: A time when you failed, made a mistake, or didn't meet expectations.
tips: Own the failure completely - no blame shifting
Show what you learned and how you improved
Demonstrate resilience and growth mindset
Include what you'd do differently now

story_slots.title: Going Above & Beyond
story_slots.description: A time when you went significantly beyond your job requirements to drive impact.
tips: Show intrinsic motivation and passion
Demonstrate seeing the bigger picture
Highlight impact beyond your immediate role
Show how you inspired or enabled others

story_slots.title: Leading Without Formal Authority
story_slots.description: A time when you influenced or led others despite not being their manager.
tips: Focus on HOW you built credibility and trust
Show specific influence tactics you used
Demonstrate understanding of stakeholder motivations
Highlight sustainable impact on team or org

story_slots.title: Rapid Learning / Growth Story
story_slots.description: A time when you had to quickly learn a new technology, domain, or skill to succeed.
tips: Show your learning strategy and approach
Demonstrate how you applied new knowledge
Highlight ability to come up to speed quickly
Show curiosity and growth mindset

situation: How big was the system or business impact area?
Who were the users or stakeholders?
What was the team size and your role?
What timeframe are we talking about?
problem: What was at stake if you didn't solve this?
actions: What were your 3-5 key decisions or moves?
Focus on 'I' not 'we' - what did YOU do?
What principles or values guided your decisions?
How did you bring others along?
results: Can you quantify the impact? (metrics, revenue, latency, etc.)
What would have happened if you hadn't intervened?
coda: What did you learn from this experience?
What would you do differently now?
How has this shaped your approach since?
What broader lessons apply to other situations?

follow_up_question_templates: How did you bring skeptics on board?
What would you do differently if you could redo this?
What feedback did you get from stakeholders?
How did this experience change your approach?
What was the hardest part of this?
What did you learn about yourself?
How did you prioritize competing needs?
